questions.question: Which column (excluding row_id) has the highest fraction of missing values? Return the single column name.

Considering only columns ['instant', 'dteday', 'season', 'yr', 'mnth', 'hr', 'holiday', 'weekday', 'workingday', 'weathersit', 'temp', 'atemp', 'hum', 'windspeed', 'casual', 'registered', 'cnt'], how many rows have at least one missing value? Return the count.

Considering only columns ['instant', 'dteday', 'season', 'yr', 'mnth', 'hr', 'holiday', 'weekday', 'workingday', 'weathersit', 'temp', 'atemp', 'hum', 'windspeed', 'casual', 'registered', 'cnt'], which row_id has the largest number of missing values? If tied, return the smallest row_id.
Which column is a duplicate of 'temp'?
Which pair of columns are identical for all rows (excluding row_id)? Return the two column names sorted alphabetically.
How many rows have temp != feature_0429? Return an integer.
What is the Pearson correlation between 'temp' and 'atemp'? Return a number rounded to 3 decimals.
Among numeric columns excluding 'temp', which column has the highest absolute Pearson correlation with 'temp'? Return the single column name.
Among all numeric columns (excluding row_id), which pair has the highest absolute Pearson correlation? Return the two column names sorted alphabetically.
